item.title: GitHub for Static Web Publishing
item.description: This tutorial introduces GitHub as a free static website publishing platform. No installation of any software is required, however, you will need a GitHub account. By the end of this tutorial, you will have your own version of an open textbook template available to your further editing. This tutotial is estimated to take between 30 and 60 minutes to complete. Prerequisities A free GitHub account Familarity with basic Markdown and YAML syntax Topics Covered

item.title: Introduction to Static Site Generators
item.description: This tutorial will teach you the basics of using a static site generator. We will be using Hugo to build our demonstration site. We’ll play the role of a scholarly communications librarian. We’ll be using a command line terminal to install software and run commands and a text editor to edit and save plain text files. This in-depth tutotial is estimated to take between one and two hours to complete.
